screen_design_ref: Figure 5.1: Terms of Service Page Layout
description: Verify that the Terms of Service page loads correctly when accessing the /terms-of-service URL
scenario: User navigates to the Terms of Service page to read the legal terms and conditions
expected_results: Display the complete Terms of Service page with header, content sections, and proper legal information
procedure:
1. Open web browser
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/terms-of-service
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check page title displays 'Terms of Service'
5. Verify all terms sections are visible and properly formatted

description: Verify the terms of service header displays correctly with dates and document icon
scenario: User views the Terms of Service header with gradient background and legal information
expected_results: Display 'Terms of Service' title, file-text icon, subtitle about legal terms, and last updated/effective dates
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Verify header title 'Terms of Service' is visible
3. Check file-text icon is displayed
4. Verify subtitle 'Legal terms and conditions for using our service' is shown
5. Check 'Last Updated' date shows May 29, 2025
6. Verify 'Effective Date' shows June 12, 2025 (14 days after)
7. Verify green to teal gradient background is applied properly

description: Verify the terms dates are calculated correctly using the shared get_policy_dates() helper function
scenario: System generates consistent policy dates across all policy pages including terms of service
expected_results: Date updated shows May 29, 2025 and effective date shows June 12, 2025, matching other policy pages
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Check displayed 'Last Updated' date
3. Verify it shows 'May 29, 2025'
4. Check displayed 'Effective Date'
5. Verify it shows 'June 12, 2025'
6. Confirm 14-day difference between dates
7. Compare with privacy policy dates for consistency
8. Verify dates match main.py get_policy_dates() function

description: Verify the acceptance of terms section displays correctly with binding language
scenario: User reads the opening terms section to understand binding nature of agreement
expected_results: Display clear acceptance clause explaining binding nature of terms
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Scroll to 'Acceptance of Terms' section
3. Verify section heading '1. Acceptance of Terms' is displayed
4. Check content mentions 'CyberQuest' service name
5. Verify binding language 'accept and agree to be bound' is present
6. Check text explains consequences of non-acceptance
7. Verify proper formatting and readability

description: Verify the user accounts section displays account creation and security requirements
scenario: User wants to understand account requirements and responsibilities
expected_results: Display subsections for Account Creation (3.1) and Account Security (3.2) with detailed requirements
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Scroll to 'User Accounts' section
3. Verify main heading '3. User Accounts' is displayed
4. Check '3.1 Account Creation' subsection exists
5. Verify age requirement '13 years old' is mentioned
6. Check account limit 'One person may not maintain more than one account'
7. Verify '3.2 Account Security' subsection is present
8. Check account responsibility clauses are displayed
9. Verify bullet point formatting is correct

description: Verify the acceptable use policy displays permitted uses and prohibited activities
scenario: User needs to understand what activities are allowed and forbidden
expected_results: Display Permitted Uses (4.1) and Prohibited Activities (4.2) with clear guidelines
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Scroll to 'Acceptable Use Policy' section
3. Verify main heading '4. Acceptable Use Policy' is displayed
4. Check '4.1 Permitted Uses' subsection exists
5. Verify references to applicable laws and regulations
6. Check '4.2 Prohibited Activities' subsection is present
7. Verify red warning box styling for prohibited activities
8. Check list includes items like 'Upload harmful content'
9. Verify 'impersonate any person' prohibition is listed
10. Check 'automated scripts or bots' restriction is present

description: Verify the prohibited activities section displays in a prominent red warning box
scenario: User needs clear visual indication of activities that are not allowed
expected_results: Display red-bordered warning box with 'You agree NOT to use the Service to:' header
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Scroll to 'Prohibited Activities' subsection
3. Verify red warning box background styling
4. Check red border around the warning box
5. Verify 'You agree NOT to use the Service to:' header text
6. Check list includes prohibited activities like spam distribution
7. Verify unauthorized access attempts are mentioned
8. Check malware/virus distribution is prohibited
9. Test warning box responsiveness on different screen sizes

description: Verify intellectual property rights section displays our rights and user rights
scenario: User wants to understand intellectual property ownership and licensing
expected_results: Display subsections for Our Rights (5.1) and Your Rights (5.2) with licensing information
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Scroll to 'Intellectual Property Rights' section
3. Verify main heading '5. Intellectual Property Rights' is displayed
4. Check '5.1 Our Rights' subsection exists
5. Verify content mentions 'CyberQuest and its licensors'
6. Check copyright and trademark protection is mentioned
7. Verify '5.2 Your Rights' subsection is present
8. Check user content retention rights are explained
9. Verify licensing grant language is included

screen_design_ref: Figure 5.9: Privacy and Data Protection Section

5. Verify mention of 'RA 10173 (Data Privacy Act of 2012)'
6. Check text explains Privacy Policy governs data practices
7. Verify section encourages reviewing the Privacy Policy

description: Verify service availability section explains uptime and maintenance policies

4. Check bullet point about maintaining high availability

6. Check scheduled maintenance notification policy

description: Verify limitation of liability section displays in prominent yellow warning box

description: Verify termination section displays both user and company termination rights

3. Verify main heading '10. Termination' is displayed

7. Verify company's termination rights are outlined
8. Check immediate termination clause for violations

5. Verify 'Terms Change Notice Period' header with calendar icon

description: Verify contact information section displays legal contact details

description: Verify the terms of service route works correctly in main.py blueprint
scenario: User accesses terms of service through direct URL and navigation links
expected_results: Route renders terms-of-service.html template with correct date parameters
procedure:
1. Navigate directly to /terms-of-service URL
2. Verify route loads correctly from main_bp blueprint
3. Check template renders terms-of-service.html file
4. Verify date_updated and date_effective parameters are passed
5. Test route works from navigation menu links
6. Check browser URL shows correct /terms-of-service path
7. Verify route handles GET requests properly
8. Test route doesn't accept POST requests inappropriately

description: Verify the Terms of Service page displays correctly in dark mode
scenario: User toggles to dark mode and reads the terms of service
expected_results: All sections display properly with dark theme colors, readable text, and proper contrast
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Toggle dark mode using theme switcher
3. Verify page header has dark background gradients
4. Check all text is readable with proper contrast
5. Verify warning boxes maintain visibility in dark mode
6. Check yellow notice box has dark styling
7. Verify red prohibition box works in dark theme
8. Test contact information box maintains readability
9. Check all icons and elements are visible

description: Verify the Terms of Service page is responsive across different screen sizes
scenario: User views terms of service on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices
expected_results: Page content adapts properly to different screen sizes while maintaining readability
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Verify all sections display in proper layout
3. Resize browser to tablet size (768px width)
4. Check warning boxes adjust appropriately
5. Resize to mobile size (375px width)
6. Verify content stacks vertically on mobile
7. Check all text remains readable on small screens
8. Test scrolling behavior through long content
9. Verify touch interactions work properly on mobile

description: Verify page animations, transitions, and visual effects work properly
scenario: User interacts with terms of service page and observes visual feedback
expected_results: Smooth fade-in animations, proper warning box styling, and visual transitions
procedure:

2. Observe fade-in animation on page load
3. Check header section animation with opacity and timing
4. Verify content section fade-in with delay
5. Test warning box visual prominence
6. Check green header gradient animation
7. Verify footer styling transitions
8. Test animation performance on different devices

description: Verify terms of service page has proper SEO elements and metadata
scenario: Search engines and social media platforms index the terms of service correctly
expected_results: Page has proper title, meta descriptions, and structured content for SEO
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. View page source and check title tag
3. Verify title shows 'Terms of Service'
4. Check for meta description tags
5. Verify proper heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3)
6. Check structured content with semantic HTML
7. Verify legal document markup if present
8. Test page indexability
9. Check URL structure is SEO-friendly

description: Verify terms of service page can be printed properly for legal records
scenario: User wants to print the terms of service for offline legal reference
expected_results: Page prints with proper formatting, readable text, and logical page breaks
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Use browser print function (Ctrl+P)
3. Check print preview shows properly formatted content
4. Verify all sections are included in print version
5. Check warning boxes print with appropriate styling
6. Verify text remains readable in print format
7. Test page breaks occur logically between sections
8. Check margins and spacing in print layout
9. Verify printed version maintains legal document structure

description: Verify terms of service page meets accessibility standards (WCAG)
scenario: User with disabilities accesses terms of service using assistive technologies
expected_results: Page is fully accessible with proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support
procedure:
1. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
2. Test keyboard navigation through all content
3. Verify tab order is logical through sections
4. Check heading hierarchy is proper for screen readers
5. Test page with screen reader software
6. Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
7. Check focus indicators are visible
8. Test warning boxes with screen readers
9. Verify all legal content is accessible
10. Check ARIA landmarks are properly used

description: Verify terms of service page loads efficiently despite extensive legal content
scenario: User accesses terms of service and expects reasonable loading times
expected_results: Page loads within acceptable time limits with all content and styling
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache
2. Open browser developer tools Performance tab
3. Navigate to /terms-of-service page
4. Record page load time
5. Verify total load time is under 3 seconds
6. Check First Contentful Paint (FCP) metrics
7. Verify Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) is acceptable
8. Test page load on slower network connections
9. Check for any render-blocking resources
10. Verify content loads progressively
